playing around with povray

06 Jun 2008
The internship I was mentoring has ended. My intern did an excellent job working on the Palantir project. Before I announce the project to the main public, I would like to have some eyecandy so people will actually notice the announcement. That's why I'm playing around with povray and trying to make a goodlooking palantir scene.

This is what I have so far: (1.8MB, 4000x3000 pixels, fits nicely on my twin-screen desktop)

Asus: you stink

02 Jun 2008
A colleague of mine is planning to get an Eee PC from ASUS because it's cheap and very portable. If it gets stolen while you're traveling, you don't lose a lot of money.

I'm planning to go on holiday soon too, and wanted to check out the specs of the Eee PC since I've heard nothing but good about it.

Both links I found on the site I linked to above are fully flash:

http://eeepc.asus.com/global/guide.htm

http://event.asus.com/eeepc/microsites/en/index.htm

So, what's that about ASUS ? What possible advantage could you get from having the useful part of your site in flash ? The only part of that site that interests me, is the part that shows the specs. And when I got there, I was unable to zoom into the small text shown.

Big downer for ASUS.

Luckily, Wikipedia has an article on ASUS Eee PC

a vacuform oven

01 Jun 2008
It's been a long long time since I've worked on my vacuform machine. I noticed that the frame was getting dusty in the cellar, what a shame. So last weekend I went to the hardware store and bought some supplies to start building the oven that goes on the top.

Instead of using special resistance wire to build the oven like the people at TK560 are doing, I decided already last year that I would use an array of halogenn linear tubes. A small test with a single 500W tube was very promising and allowed me to mold a 5mm thick plexiglas sheet.

My oven will spread heat over an area of 1 square meter with a total of 27 lamps spread out uniformly. Of course, I will almost never use sheets that big. That's why it will be possible to switch off most of the lights and use a smaller surface. My oven will provide a way to relocate some lamps to the center so that I can have more intensive heat at the center.

This week I spent some time buildinng the parts that will hold the lamps.

Here are some pictures:
